column4: Anyways, my network is setup like this.   I have a tomato router connecting to the internet, connected to that is my windows pc (gaming) and my linux server is on the router too
is there a default firewall on hardy server?
yes... its called iptables, you can use firestarter or ufw to control it
, just install ufw : sudo apt-get install ufw , then : sudo ufw enable && sudo ufw status.
to allow traffic on port 80 to enter your machine : sudo ufw allow 80
take some time to read this page : http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=510812
but as i said...unless you already know how to manipulate iptables with awesome proficiency...you should just stick to ufw
which leads me to my next point, if your new to networking security then all of this isnt going to be obvious with out some time set aisde to read stuff
heck *i* dont even know how to manipulate iptables...its a nightmare
so have a look at installing ufw. sudo apt-get install ufw
you *should* have iptables as part of the default install....
this command will tell you if this is true or not : locate iptables | grep bin
on your hardy run : locate iptables | grep bin
now when you want to open a port, say for example , port 9999 you would use : sudo ufw allow 9999
it will pay to read this page : https://help.ubuntu.com/8.04/serverguide/C/firewall.html
and this one for general rundown on how security is handled in ubuntu : http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=510812
